page.title: 07ALNESS HOUSING
page.content: Until the 1960's Alness was a small, compact settlement. Three parallel streets,High Street, Averon Road and Perrins Road form the core of the original village. The first major new housing estate built was Salvesen Cres.,situated in the east end of town.In the early seventies new housing schemes were built to accomodate the increasing population i.e. Kirkside, Firhill, Westford, Coulpark,Burnside in the west;Shilling Hill and Milnafua in the east. As the population increased so did the number of private estates. Darroch Brae, Obsdale Park,Whitehills and Braeface Park are examples of private housing areas.These houses are modern with surrounding gardens. All these estates are situated in pleasant surroundings.
